title: Test journaling on main branch
summary: Verified that journaling works outside of sessions
detail: The system already supports journaling from any branch. Hooks use git branch --show-current as fallback, and all journal readers scan all .jsonl files.

title: Clarified journaling works on all branches, not just sessions
summary: Updated CLAUDE.md and MEMORY.md to document that journaling works everywhere
detail: User asked if journaling only works in sessions. Verified the system already supports journaling from ANY branch (main, feature, session, etc). Hooks use 'git branch --show-current' as fallback. Context Hub, memory indexer, and synopsis all read ALL .jsonl files. Updated docs to make this clear. Built and linked CLI.
learned: System already supported non-session journaling, just needed doc clarity
Hooks have fallback logic that makes it work everywhere

title: Documentation update committed and pushed
summary: Committed and pushed journaling documentation clarification to main
detail: Updated CLAUDE.md and template/CLAUDE.md to clarify that journaling works on ALL branches (not just sessions). Committed with detailed message and pushed to origin/main. This fix will now be distributed to all JFL users via the template.
next: Template is ready for distribution to jfl-template repo when synced

title: Implemented GTM agent notification on service /end
summary: Service ending now triggers GTM agent to process updates automatically
detail:
Built automatic GTM agent spawning when services end:

1. Service side: phoneHomeToGTM() now writes trigger file to GTM/.jfl/inbox/service-update-*.trigger after syncing
2. GTM side: PostToolUse hook watches for trigger files being written
3. Hook runs 'jfl gtm process-service-update' which displays agent prompt
4. Agent reads service journals, updates GTM state (ROADMAP, journal, knowledge)

Architecture:
- Service writes to .jfl/service-events.jsonl (log)
- Service writes trigger file (hook detector)
- GTM hook spawns agent with full context
- Agent has summary but can ask for more detail

Files created/modified:
- src/commands/gtm-process-update.ts (new CLI command)
- src/index.ts (added gtm command group)
- src/lib/service-gtm.ts (writes trigger file)
- template/.claude/settings.json (added hook)
learned: Hooks can't detect file changes from TypeScript - need explicit Write tool call
Trigger files are a clean pattern for cross-agent communication
next: Test the flow end-to-end with a real service

title: GTM agent notification system shipped
summary: Committed and pushed GTM agent auto-spawn feature
detail: Implemented, tested, and shipped the GTM agent notification system. When a service runs /end, it now automatically triggers the GTM agent to process the update. GTM agent receives full context (commits, journals, duration, synced files) and can update GTM state accordingly. This closes the service-GTM feedback loop - GTM stays up to date automatically without manual intervention.
next: Test end-to-end with a real service ending to validate the full flow

title: Add library service type for plugins and packages
summary: Implemented new 'library' service type to support OpenClaw plugins, npm packages, and shared code repositories that don't run as standalone services but still need JFL tracking and agent support
detail: Added 'library' to service type definitions across codebase. Implemented auto-detection for OpenClaw plugins (openclaw.plugin.json) and npm libraries (exports/main without start scripts). Updated peer agent generator with library-specific capabilities (code development, testing, documentation, build artifacts) and when-to-use guidance. Modified files: service-detector.ts, index.ts, onboard.ts, peer-agent-generator.ts, service-gtm.ts, SERVICE-MESH.md. Ready to onboard openclaw-stratus-x1-plugin.
